list.item: Update (or checkout a new copy) of the chetc-js module from CVS and verify that it works as expected for the purposes of the current release
Using your CVS client, create a new tag in the repository corresponding to the current release (see Release Tag Guide for policy on tag syntax)

Export (not checkout or update) the chetc-js module from CVS, using the tag value you just created, into the root directory of a volume (this will create a chetc-js directory containing files and sub-directories)

Create a zip file, being sure to include path information for subdirectories, with the following name style:
chetc-js-NEW-TAG-HERE.zip

Upload the zip file to sourceforge:
Using an FTP client, connect to upload.sourceforge.net (username: anonymous; password: your email address) and then change directories to incoming
After setting the file transfer mode to binary, put the zip file only in the incoming directory and make a note of the filename, because you'll need it again later in the process

Set up the release information on sourceforge:
Login to sourceforge and navigate to the EpiDoc project page
Select the Admin link, then the File Releases link
Scroll down the page to the File Release Packages list, and select therein the Add Release link associated with the chetc-js package
On the Create a File Release page, enter the appropriate release designation in the text box labeled New release name (this will usually be the CVS tag value for the release, minus the leading r-)
Select the Create This Release button.
On the resulting page, under the heading Step 1: Edit Existing Release:
((( eventually we need policy and instructions on release notes and change logs, but for now, skip it )))
Under the heading Step 2: Add Files To This Release:
Select the zip file that you previously uploaded and select the Add Files and/or Refresh View button (if you do not see the zip file in the list, select the button to refresh the list)
Under the heading Step 3: Edit Files In This Release:
Set the Processor combo box to read Platform-Independent
Set the File Type combo box to read source .zip
Leave the default settings for the Release combo box and Release Date text box
Select the Update/Refresh button
Select the Files link to verify that the release package is now in place and publicly visible.
